contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Governor |name = William Read Miller |image =WRMiller.jpg |order = 12th |office = Governor of Arkansas |term_start = 1877 |term_end = 1881 |lieutenant = |predecessor = [[Augustus Hill Garland]] |successor = [[Thomas James Churchill]] |birth_date = {{birth date|1823|11|23}} |birth_place = [[Batesville, Arkansas]] |death_date = {{death date|1887|11|29}} |death_place = [[Little Rock, Arkansas]] |party = [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] |spouse =Susan Elizabeth Bevens |profession = Lawyer |religion = Presbyterian }} '''William Read Miller''' (November 23, 1823{{spaced ndash}}November 29, 1887) was the [[List of Governors of Arkansas|12th]] [[Governor of Arkansas|Governor]] of the State of [[Arkansas]]. ==Biography== Miller was born on a farm in [[Batesville, Arkansas]]. He was educated in local schools. ==Career== Miller was elected county clerk of [[Independence County, Arkansas]] and served from 1848-1854. He was appointed State Auditor in 1854 and was reelected to that position in 1858, 1860, 1862, and again in 1874 after [[Reconstruction era of the United States|Reconstruction]] ended. Miller studied law and was [[Admission to the bar in the United States|admitted to the bar]] in 1868. Miller was elected Governor of Arkansas in 1876, and was reelected in 1878. Miller was the first native born Arkansas governor.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.oldstatehouse.com/exhibits/virtual/governors/the_redeemers/miller.aspx|title=William Read Miller (1877-1881)|publisher= Ohio State House Museum|accessdate=August 14, 2012}}</ref> The Miller administration focused on public education and the state's financial problems. He signed legislation that funded the State Blind Asylum and the [[University of Arkansass|Arkansas Industrial University]]. After leaving office Miller served as the Deputy Treasurer of Arkansas in 1881 and 1882. In 1886, he was elected to the position of State Auditor. ==Family life and death== Miller was married to Sarah Susan Bevers and they had seven children. Miller is buried at the historic [[Mount Holly Cemetery]] in [[Little Rock, Arkansas]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=19653|title=William Read Miller|publisher= Find A Grave|accessdate=August 14, 2012}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.encyclopediaofarkansas.net/encyclopedia/entry-detail.aspx?entryID=115 Encyclopedia of Arkansas History & Culture entry] * [http://www.nga.org/cms/home/governors/past-governors-bios/page_arkansas/col2-content/main-content-list/title_miller_william.html National Governors Association] * [http://www.oldstatehouse.com/exhibits/virtual/governors/the_redeemers/miller.aspx Old State House Museum] {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{succession box |title=[[List of Governors of Arkansas|Governor of Arkansas]] | years = 1877-1881 | before = [[Augustus Hill Garland]] | after = [[Thomas James Churchill]] }} {{s-end}} {{Governors of Arkansas}} {{Authority control|VIAF=11744286}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Miller, William R. | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = November 23, 1823 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Batesville, Arkansas]] | DATE OF DEATH = November 29, 1887 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Little Rock, Arkansas]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Miller, William R.}} [[Category:Governors of Arkansas]] [[Category:1823 births]] [[Category:1887 deaths]] [[Category:Arkansas Democrats]] [[Category:Democratic Party state governors of the United States]] [[Category:American Presbyterians]] [[Category:People from Independence County, Arkansas]]
